bibl.title: Revd John Ashton Will
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div1.head: April Term 1816 —
Revd John Ashton. Will —
div1.p: In the Name of God the Father son and Holy Ghost Amen. I John Ashton of Charles County in the State of Maryland being of sound memory and understanding do constitute and make this my last will and testament evoking all wills made prior to the date hereof—
Imprimis. I bequeath my soul to God in whose mercies I place all my hopes and my body to the earth to be decently intered at St Thomas's burying Ground with a solemn Mass of Requiem—

div1.head: April Term 1816 —
div1.p: Item I bequeath to my Good friend the Reverend Nottey Young the following tracts of land lying in Charles County near Port Tobacco and now in my possession vizt A tract of land called Chandlers Hills where I now live containing two Hundred acres of land more or less; A tract of land called St. Nicholas containing two Hundred acres of land more or less; a tract of land called Green a containing one Hundred acres of land more or less; a tract of land called little worth containing one Hundred and sixty four acres more or less; a tract of land called Small Profit containing one Hundred and thirty six acres more or less; The unsold parts of two tracts of land called Campbells Chance and Struthbrant lying on Elk ridge in Ann arundel County amounting to about two Hundred and fifty acres by conjecture and now for sale. I bequeath to a youth called Charles Queen and to his sister Elizabeth Queen the children of Susanna Queen the unalienated part of a tract of land called Litchfield Enlarged lying in Charles County whereon they now live with all the stock of Horses, Hogs, Cattle, and utensils of every kind found thereon at my death together with the Tobacco Grain and Property of every description. I also give to the said Charles a negro Man called Butler and the Male children of a Negro woman called Linny and I give to his sister Elizabeth the negro woman called Linny with her other children. I give to the aforesaid Nottey Young all the property which I hold on the books of the United States loan office, Bank stock, Baltimore insurance office by Note or by Bond charging him with the payment of all my debts and contracts. I give and bequeath to the same Nottey Young all other real personal or mixed Estate of which I may be possessed at my death charging him with the

div1.head: April Term 1816 —
div1.p: payment of one Hundred dollars to be laid out in Charity to the poor and suffringes for the repose of my soul together with funeral expences. Item I do constitute and appoint him the said Nottey Young my whole and sole Executor of this my last Will and Testament. In witness whereof I have hereunto set my hand and seal this twelfth day of February in the year of our Lord one thousand eight Hundred and Ten.
Signed sealed published and declared by John Ashton the above named testator as and for his last will and testament

in presence of us
John E Ford
Igns Semmes
Jno Gittings

On the back of the aforegoing will it is thus written Charles County Set. March 15th 1815 Then came Ignatius Semmes one of the subscribing witnesses to the within and aforegoing last will and testament of the Revd John Ashton late of Charles County deceased and made oath on the Holy Evangely of Almighty God that he did see the testator therein named sign and seal this will and that he heard him publish, pronounce and declare the same to be his last will and testament that at the time of his so doing he was to the best of his apprehension of sound and disposing mind memory and understanding and that he together with John E Ford and John F. Gittings the other subscribing witnesses respectively subscribed their names as witnesses to this will in the presence and at the request of the testator and in the presence of each other.
6¾ sides 630 Wit Humphrey Barnes Reg. of Wills
